#Text=Plitvice Lakes National Park
#Text=Plitvice Lakes National Park ( Nacionalni park Plitvička jezera ) in Croatia is one of the most beautiful natural sights in Europe .
#Text=Due to its beauty and significance , this system of 16 interlinked lakes and a large forest complex around it were set aside as a national park in 1949 .
#Text=In 1979 the park was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage site List .
#Text=Many Germans will recognize features of the park , as many of the Karl May Westerns were shot here .
#Text=History
#Text=Humans have inhabited the Plitvice Lakes area for thousands of years .
#Text=It was settled in turn by Illyrians , Thracians , Celts , Japods , Romans , Avars , Slavs and Turks .
#Text=The area fell to the Ottomans in 1528 , and was retaken by the Austrian Empire 150 years later .
#Text=The Austrians incorporated it into their Military Frontier and , in addition to the native Croats who already inhabited the region , Serbs who had fled Ottoman repression settled there .
#Text=The Plitvice Lakes became a major tourist attraction in the late 19th century .
#Text=The first hotel was built in 1896 , and as early as 1893 it had a conservation committee – the predecessor of today 's national park authority .
#Text=In 1949 the communist government of Yugoslavia nationalized the lakes and made them a national park .

#Text=The park was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage site List in 1979 in recognition of its " outstanding natural beauty , and the undisturbed production of travertine ( tuff ) through chemical and biological action " .

column1: #Text=The park soon became one of Yugoslavia 's most popular tourist attractions .
#Text=In March 1991 it became the scene of the Plitvice Lakes incident - the first armed confrontation of the Croatian War of Independence that resulted in fatalities .
#Text=The park was held by forces of the Republic of Serbian Krajina during the conflict and suffered some damage in the process , with hotels and other facilities being used as barracks .
#Text=A massacre of three children by the Yugoslav Army occurred around Grabovac in September of 1991 .
#Text=It was retaken by the Croatian Army in August 1995 during Operation Storm , which ended the Croatian war .
#Text=The war led UNESCO to add the park to its List of World Heritage in Danger .

#Text=Due to the economic importance of the park , the Croatian government made it a priority for its de-mining efforts , and in December 1998 UNESCO recognized the parks new mine-free status by removing it from the list of endangered sites .
#Text=The surrounding municipalities outside the park boundaries still have minor problems with mine contamination .
#Text=Landscape
#Text=The lakes are on the Plitvice plateau , between the mountains of Lička Plješevica ( Gornja Plješevica peak 1,640 m ) , Mala Kapela ( Seliški Vrh peak at 1,280 m ) and Medveđak ( 884 m ) .

#Text=The 26 lakes are separated into an upper and lower cluster formed by runoff from the mountains , descending from an altitude of 636 m to 503 m over a distance of some 8 km , aligned in a south-north direction .
#Text=The lakes collectively cover an area of about 2 km ² , with the water exiting from the lowest lake to form the Korana River .
#Text=The Plitvice Lakes lie in a basin of karstic rock , mainly dolomite and limestone , which has given rise to their most distinctive feature .
#Text=The lakes are separated by natural dams of travertine , which is deposited by the action of moss , algae and bacteria .
#Text=The encrusted plants and bacteria accumulate on top of each other , forming travertine barriers which grow at the rate of about 1 cm per year .
#Text=The lakes are renowned for their distinctive colours , ranging from azure to green , grey or blue .
#Text=The colours change constantly depending on the quantity of minerals or organisms in the water and the angle of sunlight .
#Text=The lakes are divided into the 12 Upper Lakes ( Gornja jezera ) and the four Lower Lakes .
#Text=Flora and fauna
#Text=The Plitvice Lakes national park is heavily forested , mainly with beech , spruce , and fir trees , and features a mixture of Alpine and Mediterranean vegetation .
#Text=It has a notably wide variety of plant communities , due to its range of microclimates , differing soils and varying levels of altitude .
#Text=The area is also home to an extremely wide variety of animal and bird species .
#Text=Rare fauna such as the European brown bear , wolf , eagle , owl , lynx , wild cat and capercaillie can be found there , along with many more common species .
#Text=At least 126 species of birds have been recorded there , of which 70 have been recorded as breeding there .
#Text=Climate
#Text=The area knows a mountainous land climate , with hot summers and cold winters .
#Text=Although generally cooler than coastal Croatia because of its altitude , sunny days in summer get very hot with temperatures up to 35°C .
#Text=As there are few opportunities to buy refreshments in the park , visitors should bring plenty of water along for rehydration .

#Text=In the evening , occasional thunderstorms can unleash large amounts of rain in a short time , so make sure to keep an eye on the weather forecast to avoid being surprised by heavy rain in the absence of shelter .
#Text=The many calm streams in the park may quickly transform into wild water torrents , so stay away from the water in case of heavy rain .
#Text=In winter , heavy snowfall can be expected , enabling the Mukinje Ski Resort to operate from December to early March .
#Text=Fog is common in the morning and can occur very locally , making driving up and down the often narrow roads in the park hazardous .
#Text=Tourist information

#Text=Nacionalni park Plitvička jezera ( Plitvice Lakes National Park ) , Josipa Jovića 19 , Znanstveno - stručni centar " Dr. Ivo Pevalek " , HR 53231 Plitvička jezera , ☏ +38553751015 , ✉ info@np-plitvicka-jezera.hr . 07:00-20:00.

#Text=Aug : 180 kn ; Apr-Jun , Sep-Oct : 110 kn ; Nov-Mar : 55 kn ; 2-day cards 280 , 180 , 90 kn respectively ; discounts for students ( an ISIC student card is required ) and children ; tickets sold at the entrances and they are also valid for park 's internal buses and ferries .
#Text=Tickets often sell out leaving people disappointed at the park gate .
#Text=To avoid this , buy your tickets online a minimum of two days in advance .
#Text=If you plan on purchasing tickets at the entrance do arrive early , especially on weekends. .
